page.title: 17Youth & Help:Chinnor etc
page.content: Continued from Page 16O However if teenagers are restricted to the village it is felt that lack of interesting activities will produce restless and bored young people with energy to spare. Already vandalism is on the increase and there have been several cases of arson reported. Villagers, through the Parish Council, are asking for finance to improve facilities. A Charitable Trust exists in Chinnor using funds obtained from the sale of the old village school. This Trust provides grants to young people of Chinnor for educational purposes. Sydenham has its own Munday's Charity. The family of Munday is old established in this village. The Charity aids older people with money for personal bills, allotment provision and Christmas presents.
